etymologies: mid 17th century: alteration (by association with blunder) of Dutch donderbus, literally ‘thunder gun’

definitions: a short-barreled large-bored gun with a flared muzzle, used at short range.
shortDefinitions: short large-bored gun firing balls or slugs

definitions: an action or way of doing something regarded as lacking in subtlety and precision

examples.text: economists resort too quickly to the blunderbuss of regulation

shortDefinitions: action or way of doing something regarded as lacking in subtlety and precision
